intro: Monadenia australiensis, commonly known as the Australian sunflower, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. It has small, oval-shaped leaves and produces numerous small seeds in its flower heads. Monadenia australiensis is adapted to arid conditions and is an important component of local ecosystems.
